intro: Vanoverberghia, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that resemble dandelion petals, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Vanoverberghia is adapted to arid conditions and has a low-growing, mat-forming habit.
